definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: Must strict military discipline is the primary problem.
sentences.chinese: 肯定嚴明軍紀是首要問題啊。

sentences.english: So much for the army discipline.
Its officers enforced strict discipline, yet had no rank.
sentences.chinese: 它的軍官紀律嚴明，卻沒有軍銜。

sentences.english: When the soldiers are not disordered, discipline will be well maintained.
sentences.chinese: 士卒不混亂，紀律就嚴明瞭。

sentences.english: Above is the report by VOA correspondent Yan Ming from Toronto.
sentences.chinese: 以上是美國之音特約記者嚴明從多倫多發來的報道。

sentences.english: They are admired for their labour discipline.
sentences.chinese: 他們由於勞動紀律嚴明而受到人們的欽佩。

sentences.english: He is made of Luoyang, and his upright, without fear of power, strict law enforcement.
sentences.chinese: 他是洛陽令，爲人剛正，不畏權勢，執法嚴明。

sentences.english: The army is strict in discipline.

sentences.chinese: 他們紀律嚴明地一齊射擊。

sentences.english: 'But it's a complicated market that requires significant discipline and thoughtfulness.'
sentences.chinese: 但中國市場情況複雜，需要紀律嚴明與深思熟慮。

sentences.english: The soldier showed perfect discipline under fire.
sentences.chinese: 在炮火下，士兵們紀律嚴明。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
